block.p: MicroStrategy Inc. announced two settlements yesterday, totaling nearly $97 million, in lawsuits filed against the company after it came under investigation for misstating its earnings since 1997. In the first, which settles a class action suit filed in Federal District Court in Virginia, members of a class-action group will be awarded $80.5 million plus 550,000 MicroStrategy shares that the company says are worth $16.5 million. The second agreement settles a shareholder's lawsuit, and requires the company to name a new independent director to its board's audit committee. Also as part of the second agreement, three of the company's officers, including Michael J. Saylor, founder and chief executive, will be required to contribute a portion of the 550,000 shares with a total value of $10 million. MicroStrategy said it would receive $13 million from its insurance carriers to help pay the settlements.
